4427915/4357566/4452863.title: Cures for Warts
4427915/4357566/4452863.text: Cures for wartslong ago the people used to make cures for warts out of dandelion leaves, water and the root of a dark leaf.It is said that if you would wash your hands in the water of a rock it is a cure for warts.it is said that if you would get a bit of meat and rub it on the meat and then bury it and let no one see you doing it that the warts would go off your hands.

4427923/4357999/4454106.text:
(a) Cuimil seilmide artha, agus annsin croch ar dheilg sgeithe é, agus de réir agus lobhann sé imthigheann na faithní.(b)Má fhághann tú uisge i bpoll cloiche agus go nigheann tú na faithní ann imthigheann siad i gceann sgaithim.(c) Goid píosa de bágúin shailleach agus cuir ar na faithní ag dul a chodladh duit. Nuair eirigheann tú ar maidin cuir ar dheilg sgeithe agus tárluigheann mar do thárla in (a) thuas.(d) Faigh croiceann eascon agus ceangal ar na faithní é, agus is gearr cidhtear iad ina dhiadh sin.(e) Má chimilleann tú rud eicín leis na faithní, agus annsinn é a chaitheamh ar an mbóthar. 4427930/4358792/4454973.title: St Patrick's Cabbage
4427930/4358792/4454973.text:
An herb, known as St. Patrick's Cabbage or in Irish as "Cruag Phádraigh" was supposed to be a great cure for all classes of cuts and burns.While rubbing the herb to the affected part it was customary to say Five 'Our Fathers', five 'Hail Marys' and five 'Glorias'. If the rubbing and prayers did not go together the cure failed.



When curing a person of worms in ancient times the people made what was called the "worm's knot" and laid it on the stomach of the sufferes,saying while doing so"O Lord banish the evils that beset this child In the name of the Father and of the son and of the Holy Ghost Amen"



When an individual got warts it was believed that he could be cured of them by applying water which would be lodged in the hollow of a stone to the warts saying while doing so: Pisg an cloch an aeramFan aca taoramTá mé geara One trí

4428214/4386581/4456577.text:
(continued from previous page)

An old cure for cuts is a spiders web like the ones found in the rafters of old houses, dipped in whiskey and wrapped around the cut and tied with a bandage.  This is said by the old people to stop a cut from bleeding and to heal it.



It is also believed by most of the old people that there is a cure for warts in the water that fills the holes at the foot of trees after rain.  Another cure for warts is to rub on to them the lime which drops from the under side of some bridges

4428221/4386921/4456907.title: A Cure for Warts
4428221/4386921/4456907.text: A cure for warts is to stick a pin into a slug and then to hide the slug. It is said that when the slug dies the wart falls out.Another cure for warts is to be rub a piece of wart weed on them

4428124/4380376/4461585.text: Chun ruaig do chur ar fhaithne cuir an uimhir céudhna clocha i mála is atá de fhaithne agat agus fág ag cros bóthar iad. 4428124/4380379/4461595.text: 1. Seilmide do chimilt don fhaithne. Ba cheart an seilmide do chrochadh ar chrann sgeiche gile. Nuair a bheadh an faithne imighthe.2. 4463715/4374052/4463762.title: A Cure for Warts
4463715/4374052/4463762.text: Warts can be cured in the following way:-Get a black snail and rub him on the warts.   Then get a piece of string and tie it tightly around the snail and leave him beside the fire.   When the snail will die the warts will go.My mother who had warts on her hands tried this cure about a year ago and it was a success.

4463715/4374060/4463785.title: A Cure for Warts
4463715/4374060/4463785.text: A cure for warts is to pull 9 wisps out of a rick of straw and make  the sign of the cross on the warts with them .When this is done cover the wisps some place so that they will rot away.   While the wisps are rotting the warts will rot away also.

4428251/4388476/4465991.title: (no title)
4428251/4388476/4465991.text:
Long ago people had many cures. A cure for a wart was to cut nine slices of potato and to rub them on the wart saying :- In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost. Amen. Then you were to tie them up in a parcel and leave then at a cross-roads. When you were going home you weren’t to look back. Whoever found the parcel got the warts and the person who had them got better.



On most houses in Ireland there grows a little green plant called house-leek. This is supposed to be a cure for a corn. A cure for a wart was to put spittle on the wart saying – In the name of the Father and of the Son etc. You were to be fasting when you did this. You were supposed to do it for nine mornings.

4428251/4388490/4466122.title: A Cure for Warts
4428251/4388490/4466122.text:
If you accidentally come across a small hole in a stone with some water in it, dip your finger into it and rub the water on the wart and say “In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost” three times.



In Ardfarna there is a field, and in this field there are supposed to be sods known as "stray sods". One night a man named Patrick Seallen was going home and it was a cold, dark, stormy night and it was hard to see very far. When he was going through this field he walked on one of those stray sods. Then he began to think he didn’t know where he was. He kept walking on and early the next morning he found himself lying on the road and his head pouring blood.

4427966/4361883/4466900.title: Ringworm
4427966/4361883/4466900.text:
The seventh son of a family has a cure of ring worm. He leaves his hand on the sore and it cures it.



The cure for lumbago is a mustard plaster. Get some mustard or two pieces of swanskin and tie it round the back and it will cure it or or get mjustard and linseed meal and make a poultice of it and put it to the back and it will soon cure it.



The seventh daughter of a family is said to have a cure for a pain in the back. Se she leaves her hand on the back and the pain goes.



This is a cure for worts. If there is a hole in a rock where there is water, and to wash the worts well with it they will soon go. There is another cure for worts that is to steal a bit of meat out of a house to hide it in the dung pu pit and when the meat would be rotten the worts will go.



The cure for a sprained ankle is hold the foot under a water fall and the the swelling will go down. There is another cure for a sprained ankle. Go to the weaver and ask for a sprain

4427999/4366195/4468859.title: Leigheasanna - Tinneas Cinn
4427999/4366195/4468859.text:
Bhiodh go leor leigheasanna ag ná daoine fado ar Tinneas Cinn ceangailtí piosa tead thart air an ceann agus d'imtigeadh an tinneas cinn. Biodh leigeas eile aca cuireadh siad uiscefuar anuas air an gceann agus d'imtigeadh an pian annsin. Tomaistear an ceann le snáthaidh figeadora comh mait. Dhéanfad siad ortha thomhasiad siad an ceann, dearad siad paidreaca agus annsin d'imtigeadh an tinneas cinn.Ceangailtí píosa ribín thart ar an gceann. Binneog an t-ainm a bhiodh ar an bpiosa ribín sin. Uaireannta eile gheibhtí téad dubh agus tomhasiad siad an ceann agus cuirtí comhartha ná croise trí h-uaire ar an nghruaig agus d'imtigeadh an tinneas cinn.

4476320/4370710/4476361.title: A Prayer for Stopping Blood
4476320/4370710/4476361.text:
In the stable of Bethlehem our Lord was born,In the river Jordan he was baptised,The water was pure and the water was good,When Jesus came there the water stood.In the name of Jesus I stop the blood.Mary Maloney, Kincon, Killala, Mayo. Got from James Ward, Moneygall, Coughjordan, Co Tipperary.



Cure for warts.steal a bit if meat or grease from a neighbours house. Rub it to the warts. Bury the piece of meat or grease which has been rubbed on the wart under a seraw or in the manure heap. When the week has rounded the wart will have disappeared.Another cure for warts is to cut the warts and put some of the gerud off the wart on a bit of paper.

4428253/4388977/4476481.title: Cure for Mumps
4428253/4388977/4476481.text:
Every son and daughter has the cure for the mumps if they have a father and mother of the one name: I you get this person to lead you by a rope to water you will soon be cured.



There is a man named Johnson who has a cure for Itch. He lives near Donegal town.



There is a cure for chin cough by going under a donkey three times.



There is a cure for warts by getting a hole in a stone in which there is water a rub it on the wart but you must not be looking for it.



There is a well in the townland of Carrickboy in which there is a cure for a headache.

4428300/4392689/4476558.title: Local Cures - Warts
4428300/4392689/4476558.text:
Warts1.  If when on a journey you see a snail accidentally and rub it to the wart three times you have started the cure. Then get a piece of cord and hang the snail to a holly bush. When the snail is decayed the warts are supposed to have gone. 2.  If you happen to see a little hole of water in a rock and bathe the warts with it in Name of The Father, Son and Holy Ghost the warts will disappear inside nine days. 3.  Cut a potato in as many parts as there are warts to be cured, rub a piece to each wart in Name of the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. Then bury the pieces of potato in dry ground and when the potato is decayed the warts are gone. 4.  To allow warts to be licked by the seventh son born posthumous at the seventh hour on the seventh day after old May Day.
(continues on next page)

4428253/4388585/4476616.title: Cure for Warts
4428253/4388585/4476616.text:
When you go into a butchers shop steal a little bit of meat and make sure there is nobody about. Bury this bit of meat and as the meat rots away the wart withers away.



A person suffering from the mumps is brought to a running stream and the person must be blindfolded. The person is then given a spoonful of water and made walk over the stream three times. This is said to cure the mumps.

4428253/4388588/4476625.title: Cure for the Whooping-Cough
4428253/4388588/4476625.text:
Get a hair out of the head of a child whose father died before it was born and put a small rib of it on to a piece of bread and jam and give it to a child to eat. That child will never take the whooping cough.



Get ten pieces of knotted straw bury one of them. Then rub the other nine on the warts three times a day for three days. Then bury them and when they have rotted. The warts disappear.



The first hickup that comes say there goes one of them. when the second one comes say there goes two of them. if a third one comes say there goes three of them and the fourth one will never come

4428258/4389399/4476921.title: Local Cures - For Warts
4428258/4389399/4476921.text: A black snail is rubbed to wart in the Name of the Father Son Holy Ghost. The snail is then tied to a bush. By the time the snail has withered away the wart will have disappeared. Another Cure for WartsA raw potato is cut in two. rubbed to the wart In the Name of the Father etc. The two parts are then buried and as they rot the warts disappear. To have the desired effect it is said here that the potato must be stolen from a neighbor’s house. Another cure for wartsTake three reeshes [?], peel them, rub to wart and then bury them.  Water found accidentally in a hole in a stone and rubbed on warts is said to cure them.

4478458/4391861/4478478.title: To Cure Warts
4478458/4391861/4478478.text:
Get a blade of grass with the knot in the middle of the blade at the year's growth, and roll the blade in brown paper and put it in your pocket. Loose it sometime you don't notice, and by the time the grass withers the wart will be gone.



Get some bran and put it in a tin and heat some until it is quite warm. Get a stocking and put the bran in it and then tie it on your ear and in the morning it will be quite better.
(continues on next page)

4428281/4391555/4479120.title: Old Cures - Warts
4428281/4391555/4479120.text: Warts1. Get nine straws and put a knot on each straw. Rub each knot to the warts in the three best Names.This will take the warts away.2. Get a raw potato and cut it into four pieces. Put the pieces into a bag and throw the bag away. Whoever gets the bag takes the warts and they will go away from you.3. Rub a snail on the warts. Then tie the snail to a bush.When the snail has rotted the warts will be gone away.

4428281/4391556/4479122.title: Old Cures - Warts
4428281/4391556/4479122.text: Warts.4. Catch a snail and lick it three times. Then the warts will be cured.5. When crossing a river if you come on a stone with a hole in it and a little water in the hole rub the water on the warts in the Three Best Names.Search for two more stones of the same kind and do the same thing. If this is done for nine days the warts will go away.6. If you cut two rushes and made the Sign of the Cross with them three times of the warts it will cure them.

Once upon a time there was a man had a sick cow. He thought that the fairies was the cause of the cow being sick. He went to a man belived had the cure the man came. He said that he could cure the cow. But something else must go in her place. The man said he would like to have the cow cured. and take chance. So he cured the cow. The following week he let out a young horse and it started to play. And broke its neck over a mud fence. It happened some distance from Letterkenny. The man who came to cure the cow was from Milford

4498605/4385324/4498609.text:

4428395/4403929/4512390.text:
Tobar BheannuightheTá tobar beannuighthe ar an Árdaigh bhig, agus 'sé an t-ainm atá air Tobar Cholmcille. Gnídh na daoine  atá 'na gcomhnuidhe i n aice an tobair úsaid de'n uisge.Bíonn turas annseo uair amháin sa bhliadhain-ar an 9adh lá de Mheitheamh.Deirtear trí coróineacha-muire ag an tobar agus tógtar trí clocha agus caithtear isteach ins an tor atá a'fás ag taoibh an tobair iad-cloch i n-aghaidh 'achan choróin-mhuire a deirtear.Tá an tobar suidhte i b-páirc, agus altóir chloch deánta ag a thaoibh. Tá sé suidhte ag bun trí theórthainn, ar ghualainn chnuic, faoí scath thor driseóige (sméar).Léaghasan sé faithní.An té ar maith leis an léaghas a fhághail caithfidh sé theacht go dtí an tobar trí luan indiaidh  a chéile, le tús ráithche, roim eirighe gréine, paidir

4493627/4405054/4514452.title: Cure for Warts

The Cure of Warts 5-10-37I know a woman who was all covered with warts on their face and hands.   There was an old woman living not far away who had the cure of warts.  The person who had the warts went to this woman to get the cure made.When she came as far as the house where the wart curer lived the person with the warts had a conversation with the wart owner.  Then she told the person with the warts to get a ball of yarn for her.When she had that done the old woman told her to kneel down and the old woman knelt down also. 4769963/4763080/4924142.text: At the north-west extremity of the Currah, where the road enters the townland of Rathbride, there is a square stone raised on a small mound. 5105151/4996448/5105271.title: The Warning
5105151/4996448/5105271.text: The Warning    "In 1920 a man living in Bunlahy district bought a new mowing machine. The next day he prepared to mow; the meadow was not far from Brian Kiernan's fort.    He was only a short time mowing when a small child suddenly stood in front of the horses. The man stopped, as the child was a stranger and he wondered greatly who it could be; he knew every child in the district and what puzzled him was how any strange child could make its way there for his house was far from the road, and there was no other one living near him.     The child said, there's a bolt loose in the machine, and when the man looked he found the loose bolt; although he had made quite sure that everything was right before starting. He tightened the bolt and was getting on to the machine but he was thrown to the ground. The child had disappeared. He took the horses and the machine home and from that day to this he never used it.     This man is about 85 and he is quite convinced of the truth of this.

5009289/5004970/5132760.title: Cure for Warts
5009289/5004970/5132760.text: In this vicinity there is an old belief that if a person were suffering from warts and if he got an oaten or wheaten straw and cut it off at the knot and made the Sign of the Cross with the straw and buried the straw, then as still as the straw would decay the wart would fade and die away. Of course this is only superstition.

5009289/5004971/5132763.title: Another Cure for Warts
5009289/5004971/5132763.text: In this locality it is believed that if a person were suffering from warts, if he got some pebbles and rubbled each of them on the warts and then put them in a paper bag and left them on the road where someone would find them the warts would disapper. It is believed that that the person who found the bag would get the warts. This, of course, is only superstition but it is believed by many people in this district.

5009338/5008470/5134927.title: A Wart Well
5009338/5008470/5134927.text: There is a wart well in Ballyknocken, .... Which was used by  people of older times to cure warts it is in a hollow rock. The people used to go to the well before sunrise and dip their wart covered hands into it and make the sign of the cross. They would then go to the side of the well and say six pater over glories. It was said that the warts used to disappear inside a week.

5044751/5036290/5137807.text: There are many cures for warts handed down for generations One is Forge -water In every forge will be found a stone trough full of water in which the smith cools his irons  It is said that if the warts are washed in this water regularly they will soon disappear.

5044586/5024014/5138440.text: 1. In Ballinagar churchyard in Killeigh Parish there is a headstone under which a priest is buried and in this headstone there is a hole where a lot of water gathers. Put the wart into this water nine times and leave nine pins in this hole and after nine days the wart will disappear.2. Rub washing soda into the wart for nine days and it will disappear.3. Find a black snail when not looking for him and rub him on the wart. Then stick him on a thorn and according as the snail rots the wart will rot also4. Get a black purse and put three stones and a cross made out of matches into it. Then rub the purse on the wart and throw it over the left shoulder. Whoever finds the purse first gets the warts5. Rub the juice of a dandelion on warts and they will disappear.6. Rub a piece of a potato on warts and bury it in the ground and when the potato rots the warts will disappear.

5044587/5024038/5138477.title: A Wart Cure
5044587/5024038/5138477.text: At one time there was a post mistress lived in Geashill names Miss Cole. She had a very big wart on her hand which gave her a lot of trouble. She met a Mrs Flattery one day who said she had ever so many but got a cure from an old lady in Tullamore. Miss Cole visited the same old lady and asked her to cure her wart. She said she would and went and fetched seven straws. She touched the wart with the ends of the straws and said some words to herself and then put the straws in the fire. When Miss Cole came home the wart began to come out, and soon it all came off her hand leaving no mark.

5162126/5156177/5197152.text: Rub beef to the warts and bury the beef in  a flower pot. Wet washing soda and rub it to them. Get three bits of straw and bury them and dont let anyone know it. While the straw is rotting the warts will be disappearing.Rub your fasting spit in the morning to the warts for a few mornings. Another cure  is to catch a large black snail and rub him on the wart; then to impale him by means of a pin or nail to  a piece of timber, bush or tree. It is the local belief that by the time the snail has withered the wart also will have withered. People are supposed locally to get wart from contact with the water in which eggs have been boiled. the people of this locality believe that any wart or any such thing of long standing that shows no sign of disappearing can be quickly got rid of in the following manner. The sufferer while fasting spit on the  heath stone and rubs  the blemish with this spittel, this is done for nine consecutive mornings at the end of which time the blemish will be well on the road towards total disappearance.
